Interaction

wiki.text:
'Interaction' is a kind of action that occurs as two or more objects have an
effect upon one another. The idea of a two-way effect is essential in the
concept of interaction, as opposed to a one-way causal effect. A closely related
term is interconnectivity, which deals with the interactions of interactions
within systems: combinations of many simple interactions can lead to surprising
emergent phenomena. Interaction has different tailored meanings in various
sciences. Changes can also involve interaction.

Casual examples of interaction outside of science include:

* Communication of any sort, for example two or more people talking to each
  other, or communication among groups, organizations, nations or states: trade,
  migration, foreign relations, transportation,
* The feedback during the operation of machines such as a computer or tool, for
  example the interaction between a driver and the position of his or her car on
  the road: by steering the driver influences this position, by observation this
  information returns to the driver.
wiki.title: interaction
